00010 #include "Jamoma.h"

00012 // constants
00013 const double k_pi = 3.1415926535897932;         // pi
00014 const double k_twopi = 6.2831853071795864;      // 2 * pi
00015 const double k_anti_denormal_value = 1e-18;     
00016 
00017 // statics and globals
00018 static long                     initialized = false;
00019 static t_hashtab        *hash_modules = NULL;                   // a hashtab of all modules (jcom.hubs) currently instantiated
00020 t_object                        *obj_jamoma_clock = NULL;               // there is only one master clock for the whole system
00021 t_object                        *obj_jamoma_scheduler = NULL;   // a shared global instance of the scheduler class (there may be others too)
00022 bool                            max5 = false;
00023 
00024 
00025 /************************************************************************************/
00026 // Init the framework
00027 
00028 void jamoma_init(void)
00029 {
00030         if(!initialized){
00031                 if(maxversion() >= 0x0500)
00032                         max5 = true;
00033                 common_symbols_init();
00034                 jamoma_symbols_init();
00035                 jamoma_clock_initclass();
00036                 jamoma_scheduler_initclass();
00037 
00038                 obj_jamoma_clock = (t_object*)object_new_typed(CLASS_NOBOX, gensym("jamoma.clock"), 0, NULL);
00039                 obj_jamoma_scheduler = (t_object*)object_new_typed(CLASS_NOBOX, gensym("jamoma.scheduler"), 0, NULL);
00040                 hash_modules = (t_hashtab*)hashtab_new(0);
00041                 initialized = true;
00042         }
00043 }
00044 
00045 
00046 t_max_err jamoma_hub_register(t_symbol *name, t_object *hub)
00047 {
00048         t_object *test = NULL;
00049         
00050         hashtab_lookup(hash_modules, name, &test);
00051         if(test)
00052                 return MAX_ERR_GENERIC;
00053         else{
00054                 hashtab_store(hash_modules, name, hub);
00055                 return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00056         }
00057 }
00058 
00059 
00060 void jamoma_hub_remove(t_symbol *name)
00061 {
00062         hashtab_chuckkey(hash_modules, name);
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 t_object* jamoma_get_hub_for_module_named(t_symbol *name)
00067 {
00068         t_object *hub = NULL;
00069         
00070         hashtab_lookup(hash_modules, name, &hub);
00071         return hub;
00072 }

00074 
00075 void jamoma_get_all_module_names(long *numModules, t_symbol ***moduleNames)
00076 {
00077         hashtab_getkeys(hash_modules, numModules, moduleNames);
00078 }

00081 t_object* jamoma_object_getpatcher(t_object *obj)
00082 {
00083         t_object *patcher = NULL;
00084         
00085         if(max5)
00086                 object_obex_lookup(obj, gensym("#P"), &patcher);
00087         else
00088                 patcher = (t_object*)gensym("#P")->s_thing;
00089         return patcher;
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 t_symbol *jamoma_patcher_getcontext(t_object *patcher)
00094 {
00095         if(max5){
00096                 return _sym_nothing;
00097         }
00098         else{
00099                 t_patcher       *p = (t_patcher*)patcher;
00100                 t_box           *box = p->p_box;
00101 
00102                 if(p->p_vnewobj != NULL){
00103                         box = (t_box *)p->p_vnewobj;
00104                         if(ob_sym(box) == gensym("bpatcher"))
00105                                 return gensym("bpatcher");
00106                         else
00107                                 return gensym("subpatcher");
00108                 }
00109                 else
00110                         return gensym("toplevel");
00111         }
00112 }
00113 
00114 
00115 typedef struct bpatcher {
00116         t_box b_box;
00117         short a,b;
00118         short c,d;
00119         short e,f;
00120         short g,h;
00121         short i,j;
00122         short k,l;
00123         short m,n;
00124         short o;
00125         Symbol *b_name;
00126         Atom b_argv[10];
00127         short b_argc;
00128 } t_bpatcher;
00129 
00130 
00131 // Don't pass memory in for this function!  It will allocate what it needs
00132 // -- then the caller is responsible for freeing
00133 void jamoma_patcher_getargs(t_object *patcher, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00134 {
00135         if(max5){
00136                 ;
00137         }
00138         else{
00139                 t_patcher       *p = (t_patcher*)patcher;
00140                 t_symbol        *context = jamoma_patcher_getcontext(patcher);
00141                 t_bpatcher      *bp;
00142                 t_box           *box = (t_box *)p->p_vnewobj;
00143                 t_atombuf       *atoms = NULL;
00144                 long            ac = 0;
00145                 t_atom          *av = NULL;
00146 
00147                 if(context == gensym("bpatcher")){
00148                         box = (t_box *)p->p_vnewobj;
00149                         bp = (t_bpatcher *)box;
00150                         
00151                         ac = bp->b_argc;
00152                         av = bp->b_argv;
00153                 }
00154                 else if(context == gensym("subpatcher")){
00155                         atoms = (t_atombuf *)box->b_binbuf;
00156                         ac = atoms->a_argc - 1;
00157                         av = atoms->a_argv + 1;
00158                 }
00159                 
00160                 if(ac && av){
00161                         *argc = ac;
00162                         *argv = (t_atom*)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom) * ac);
00163                         sysmem_copyptr(av, *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * ac);
00164                 }
00165                 else{
00166                         *argc = 0;
00167                         *argv = NULL;
00168                 }
00169         }
00170 }
00171 
00172 
00173 t_symbol* jamoma_patcher_getvarname(t_object *patcher)
00174 {
00175         if(max5){
00176                 return _sym_nothing;
00177         }
00178         else{
00179                 t_patcher       *p = (t_patcher*)patcher;
00180                 t_box           *box = (t_box *)p->p_vnewobj;
00181                 t_symbol        *s = _sym_nothing;
00182                 
00183                 if(!box)
00184                         return _sym_nothing;
00185                         
00186                 p = box->b_patcher;     
00187                 if(patcher_boxname(p, box, &s))
00188                         return s;
00189                 else
00190                         return _sym_nothing;
00191         }
00192 }

00195 // When the DSP is started, we make sure the Jamoma Clock and Scheduler 
00196 // are updated if needed
00197 void jamoma_dsp(t_object *, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00198 {
00199         jamoma_clock_dsp(NULL, sp, count);
00200 }

00203 // This is the default attribute getter for Jamoma's core
00204 // It sends the data out not only the parameter dumpout, but also
00205 // out the feedback outlet from the module
00206 // for example:
00207 //      jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/drive", _sym_symbol, (method)param_setramp, 
00208 //              calcoffset(t_param, attr_ramp));
00209 void jamoma_class_attr_new(t_class *c, char *attrName, t_symbol *attrType, method setter, method getter, long offset)
00210 {
00211         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00212         char            getterName[256];
00213         
00214         strcpy(getterName, attrName);
00215         strcat(getterName, "/get");
00216 
00217         attr = attr_offset_new(attrName, attrType, 0, getter, setter, offset);
00218         class_addattr(c, attr);
00219 
00220         class_addmethod(c, (method)jamoma_class_attr_get, getterName, A_GIMME, 0);
00221 }
00222 
00223 
00224 void jamoma_class_attr_array_new(t_class *c, char *attrName, t_symbol *attrType, long list_size, method setter, method getter, long sizeOffset, long offset)
00225 {
00226         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00227         char            getterName[256];
00228         
00229         strcpy(getterName, attrName);
00230         strcat(getterName, "/get");
00231 
00232         attr = attr_offset_array_new(attrName, _sym_atom, list_size, 0, getter, setter, sizeOffset, offset);
00233         class_addattr(c, attr);
00234 
00235         class_addmethod(c, (method)jamoma_class_attr_get, getterName, A_GIMME, 0);
00236 }
00237 
00238 
00239 void jamoma_class_attr_get(t_object *o, t_symbol *attrName, long, t_atom *)
00240 {
00241         char            cAttrName[256];
00242         t_symbol        *sAttrName;
00243         char            *temp;
00244         long            ac = 0;
00245         t_atom          *av = NULL;
00246         t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x = (t_jcom_core_subscriber_common*)o;
00247         
00248         strcpy(cAttrName, attrName->s_name);
00249         temp = strrchr(cAttrName, '/');
00250         if(temp)
00251                 *temp = 0;
00252         sAttrName = gensym(cAttrName);
00253 
00254         object_attr_getvalueof(o, sAttrName, &ac, &av);
00255         object_obex_dumpout(o, sAttrName, ac, av);
00256         if(x->hub != NULL){
00257 //              t_symbol        *attrName = (t_symbol *)object_method((t_object *)attr, gensym("getname"));
00258                 char            s[256];
00259                 t_atom          a[4];
00260         
00261                 sprintf(s, "%s:/%s", x->attr_name->s_name, attrName->s_name);
00262                 atom_setsym(a+0, gensym(s));
00263                 sysmem_copyptr(av, a+1, sizeof(t_atom) * ac);
00264                 object_method_typed(x->hub, ps_feedback, ac + 1, a, NULL);
00265         }
00266 
00267         if(ac)
00268                 sysmem_freeptr(av);
00269 }
